sen.j: 塩小路通（しおこうじどおり）は、京都市の主要な東西の通りの一つ。
sen.e: The Shiokoji-dori Street is one of the major east-west running streets in Kyoto City.
Shiokoji-dori Street is one of the major east-west streets in Kyoto City.
Shiokoji-dori Street is one of the major east-west streets in Kyoto City.

sen.j: 東は東大路通から西は大宮通まで、七条通と東海道本線の間を走る。
sen.e: It runs from the Higashioji-dori Street in the east to the Omiya-dori Street in the west between the Shichijo-dori Street and Tokaido Main Line.
It runs from Higashioji-dori Street in the east to Omiya-dori Street in the west between Shichijo-dori Street and the Tokaido Main Line.
It runs from Higashioji-dori Street in the east to Omiya-dori Street in the west between Shichijo-dori Street and the Tokaido Main Line.

sen.j: 平安京の八条坊門小路にあたる。
sen.e: It corresponds to the Hachijo-bomon-koji Street in Heiankyo.
It corresponds to Hachijo-bomon-koji Street in Heiankyo.
It corresponds to Hachijo-bomon-koji Street in Heian-kyo.

sen.j: 京都駅を北に降りてまず目に入る大通りであり、河原町通から堀川通までは京都駅烏丸口に発着するバス (交通機関)の往来が激しい。
sen.e: It is the first avenue to be found by passengers getting out of Kyoto Station to the north, and the section from Kawaramachi-dori Street and the Horikawa-dori Street is busy with many buses arriving at and departing from Karasuma-guchi gateway, Kyoto Station.

It is the first avenue to be found by passengers getting out of Kyoto Station to the north, and the section from Kawaramachi-dori Street and Horikawa-dori Street is busy with many buses arriving at and departing from the Karasuma-guchi gateway, Kyoto Station.

It is the first avenue encountered by passengers getting out of Kyoto Station to the north, and the section between Kawaramachi-dori Street and Horikawa-dori Street is busy with many buses arriving at and departing from the Karasuma-guchi gateway, Kyoto Station.

sen.j: 京都タワーに面している。
sen.e: Kyoto Tower faces this street.
Kyoto Tower faces this street.
Kyoto Tower faces this street.

sen.j: 名前の由来である塩小路は本来、一本北の現在の木津屋橋通である。
sen.e: The original Shiono-koji Street, which is the origin of the street name, was the present-day Kizuyabashi-dori Street, the next street northwards.
The original Shiono-koji Street, which is the origin of the street name, was the present-day Kizuyabashi-dori Street, the next street northward.
The original Shiono-koji Street, which is the origin of the street name, was the present-day Kizuyabashi-dori Street, the next street northward.

sen.j: 京都駅前から東へ河原町通までは京都市電（の標準軌路線）が、京都駅前から西へ西洞院通までは京都市電の狭軌路線であるN電が走っていた。
sen.e: Kyoto Municipal Streetcar was available in front of Kyoto Station; (standard gauged) trains ran east to the Kawaramachi-dori and narrow gauged trains ran west to the Nishinotoin-dori Street.
Kyoto Municipal Streetcar was available in front of Kyoto Station; (standard-gauge) trains ran east to Kawaramachi-dori Street and narrow-gauge trains ran west to Nishinotoin-dori Street.

Kyoto City Trams used to run from the front of Kyoto Station; trams (standard-gauge) ran east to Kawaramachi-dori Street and those (narrow-gauge, also called N-den) ran west to Nishinotoin-dori Street.
sen.cmt: Kyoto City Trams としました。

sen.j: 河原町通から東と堀川通から西は狭い。
sen.e: East from the Kawaramachi-dori Street and west from the Horikawa-dori Street, the street is narrower.
East from Kawaramachi-dori Street and west from Horikawa-dori Street, the street is narrower.
East from Kawaramachi-dori Street and west from Horikawa-dori Street, the street is narrower.

sen.j: 上側が東側、下側が西側。
sen.e: East is upper and west is lower.
East is upper, and west is lower.
East is upper, and west is lower.

sen.j: 左側が北側、右側が南側。
sen.e: North is on the left and south is on the right.
North is on the left, and south is on the right.
North is left, and south is right.

sen.j: 交差する道路の特記がないものは市町村道。
sen.e: Roads unless specified are operated by local municipalities.
Roads are operated by local municipalities unless otherwise specified.
Roads are operated by local municipalities unless otherwise specified.

sen.j: 沿道の主な施設
sen.e: Main Facilities along the Street
